info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 6 at 1:44AM EDT until April 9 at 6:48AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana...
East Fork White River at Columbus, Seymour, Williams, Bedford, Rivervale, and Shoals.
Flatrock River near Columbus.
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana...
Big Blue River at Shelbyville.
.Widespread and significant flooding is in progress. Rainfall amounts of four to over six inches have fallen over the past several days.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record.
* WHERE...East Fork White River at Columbus.
* WHEN...Until Wednesday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, State Road 46 flooded on both sides of I-65 at exit 68. Entrances to local businesses blocked by flood waters. A farm homestead located about 2/3 of a mile north of SR 46 just west of CR 325 W is an island. CR 325 W, CR 200 N, Georgetown and Tellman Roads submerged by several feet of water. Flood waters over east bound SR 46 bridge and SR 11 north and south of Columbus submerged by several feet of water. Serious flooding continues in Columbus and Garden City areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:00 AM EDT Sunday the stage was 15.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:00 AM EDT Sunday was 15.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 17.9 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage Tuesday evening. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
To escape rising water, take the shortest path to higher ground.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued this afternoon by around 445 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY MORNING
